results.title: Escape from New York
results.creator_credit: AVCO Embassy Pictures, Debra Hill, Larry Franco and John Carpenter
results.brief_description: John Carpenter’s “Escape from New York” images the entire metropolis as a maximum security prison, where dangerous criminals and political dissidents are sent to serve out life sentences with no chance of parole. Carpenter’s dystopic vision populates the crumbling city with subway dwelling nomads and marauding gangs that rule the streets with chaos and destruction. When the President of the United States (Donald Pleasence) crashes his plane into the prison area, condemned criminal and one time war hero Snake Plissken (played with laconic glee by Kurt Russell), is sent in to rescue him from the highly dangerous fortress. Carpenter’s cult hit is a subversive and satirical take on a New York which was at the time (it was made in 1982), riddled with crime and corruption. The film also takes swipes at right wing paranoia by offering an alarming vision of how the average American would really like to solve escalating crime. Cast includes Isaac Hayes, Harry Dean Stanton, Ernest Borgnine, Lee Van Cleef and Adrienne Barbeau.

results.title: Escape from Jupiter
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Terry Jennings, Kate Woods and Fumitaka Tajima
results.brief_description: When a volcanic eruption destroys the mining colony on Jupiter’s moon Io, Michael, Kumiko, Gereard, Kingston, Anna and a small group of surviving adults are forced to flee their crumbling world. They convert the derelict space station KL5 into a makeshift spacecraft and head off in a desperate attempt to reach Earth. Their hazardous journey takes them past the spectacular rings of Saturn and through a massive asteroid belt. As they approach the safety of Earth one last and unpredicatable disaster awaits them. There is only one chance for survival… Based on the Film Australia/NHK Co-production.

results.title: Escapade
results.brief_description:
Agnes receives a phone call in which a man named Philippe gives her a rendez-vous. Thinking it is Philippe, her fiance, with whom she just had a fight who want to kiss and make-up, Agnes decides to meet him, even though she is grounded. When she arrives at the meeting place, she is welcomed by gangsters who ask her to mellow Frank, a gangster who double-crossed them.

Credits: Producer, Christine Gouze-Renal ; director, Ralph Habib ; writers, Albert Valentin, Marcel Achard ; photography, Pierre Petit ; music, Michel Emer ; art direction, Georges Wakhevitch ; assitant directors, Claude Pinoteau, Alain Jessua.
Cast: Louis Jourdan, Dany Carrel, Roger Hanin, Margaret Hung, Jean Lec, Lise Delamare, Claude Genia.

results.title: Escalier C = Staircase C
results.brief_description:
Lafont, a rarefied, egocentric, malicious art critic, and ruthless womanizer, is jolted by a series of encounters and experiences into reconsidering his character. The film’s title refers to the floor of the apartment block where Lafont lives and periodically crosses paths with his neighbours, including a gay artist whose affection he does nothing to discourage. What begins as an intriguing character study degenerates into a superficial and soft-centered film, largely dominated by stereotypes, and of no particular distinguishing features. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Producer, Marie-Dominique Girodet ; director, Jean-Charles Tacchella ; writers, Elvire Murail, Jean-Charles Tacchella ; photography, Jacques Assuerus ; music, Raymond Alessandrini.
Cast: Robin Renucci, Jean-Pierre Bacri, Jacques Bonaffe, Catherine Leprince, Michel Aumont.

results.brief_description: Graphic footage of the eruption of Mt Vesuvius in 1946 (?). Particularly spectacular form the stress level footage of collapsing houses etc, in surrounding villages.

results.title: Erte
results.brief_description: Art Deco is perhaps the most important design movement of the Twentieth Century, and Romain de Tirtoff, better known as Erte, is the artist who contributed so much to its development and acceptance as a legitimate art form

results.title: Erskineville kings
results.creator_credit: Julio Caro, Alan White, Beyond Films and @Radical Media
results.brief_description: Barky (Marty Denniss) returns to Sydney after a two-year absence when he hears of the death of his father. He is reunited with his brother (Hugh Jackman) and friends and we learn about their unresolved issues with each other and their father. Cast includes Aaron Blabey, Andrew Wholley, Joel Edgerton and Leah Vandenberg. First time feature produced and directed by Alan White.

results.title: Errol Flynn
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
This moving drama series on important figures from Australia’s past brings Australian history to life. Errol Flynn’s natural charm and good looks saw him become a screen legend as Hollywood’s greatest swashbuckling lover and matinee idol. This film takes an irreverent look at the nineteen year old Flynn’s escapades in Sydney as he sets off on the path to notoriety.
